abstract.text: Returns an estimate of the sample location indicated by the cursor.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: An object that provides information about the estimated sample location.

Some formats may need to read some data on a per-sample basis to produce the exact sample location. For these formats, it’s more efficient to read a larger chunk of data that contains both the data to produce the exact sample location and the actual sample data.
If you implement this method, also implement
Pass the value this method returns to
to obtain the exact sample location.
To indicate that refinement isn’t necessary, return a value for
that has a zero length. If
has a non-zero length, the range for the estimated sample location needs to fully cover the refined range that
returns, and the refinement data location.
This method fails with the error
if the sample location indicated by the cursor isn’t contiguous or the method isn’t supported. In this case, use

abstract.text: This framework provides a means for developers to create format readers, video decoders, and RAW processors for media that the system doesn’t natively support.
An error code that indicates specific sample isn’t contiguous, spans more than one file, or is for some other reason unsuitable for reading directly from a file.
An object that provides information about the estimated sample location with the media.
The starting file offset and size in bytes of the data necessary to provide an accurate sample location.
A protocol that defines the information to provide about samples within a track of a media asset, and enables stepping through samples in the track in decode or presentation order.
Returns an estimate of the sample location indicated by the cursor.
Builds a sample buffer that contains the samples at the cursor that you specify.
Produces an exact sample location based on the estimated sample location and refinement data that you specify.
Tests for an earlier boundary in sample reordering.
Tests for a later boundary in sample reordering.
Moves the cursor on the decode timeline by the delta decode time that you specify.
Moves the cursor on the presentation timeline by the delta presentation time that you specify.
Moves the cursor a given number of samples in decode order.
Moves the cursor a given number of samples in presentation order.
Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.

inlineContent.text: On output, a pointer to an error object that describes why the method failed, or
if no error occurred. If you are not interested in the error information, pass
An object that provides information about the estimated sample location.
